title: Hounded after wife's suicide, Bengaluru man drives 1000 km to kill self
content: In a heart-wrenching incident, Suraj Shivanna from Bengaluru succumbed to despair and ended his life in a Nagpur hotel, mere days after his wife's unfortunate passing. Grappling with accusations of dowry harassment and the impending strain from his in-laws, Suraj and his relatives were attempting to escape when the incident occurred.

title: New Year's in Bengaluru: Parties must end by 1am; check rules
content: Bengaluru police have mandated that New Year's Eve celebrations at commercial establishments must conclude by 1 am. Venues are prohibited from exceeding their holding capacity and must close entry once full, with no waiting allowed outside. Offensive songs and slogans are banned, and security measures including screening and fire safety are compulsory.

title: Dehradun racial abuse: Tripura student stabbed to death; was called ‘chinki’, ‘momo’
content: A 24-year-old MBA student from Tripura, Anjel Chakma, tragically died in Dehradun after a brutal stabbing, reportedly triggered by racial abuse. He was attacked on December 9th. The incident has sparked outrage and calls for justice, with authorities intensifying efforts to apprehend the main absconding accused.

title: Watch: 3 men harass woman rider for several kilometres in Bengaluru
content: Though an official X post, the SG Palya police station stated on Saturday that it had registered an FIR, arrested and remanded three men to judicial custody, who, according to a witness, were harassing a girl for several kilometres on a main road. According to the on-site witness, who recorded a video as evidence, the incident occurred before 10 pm.

title: Tech titans on move: Two of world’s biggest tech billionaires may cut California ties
content: Prominent tech billionaires like Larry Page and Peter Thiel are considering leaving California due to a proposed 5% wealth tax on those worth over $1 billion.

title: 2 Muslim boys booked for 'breach of peace' after attending Hindu friend’s birthday party in UP
content: In Bareilly, Uttar Pradesh, two Muslim men were fined for "breach of peace" after attending a Hindu friend's birthday party. The incident occurred when Bajrang Dal members disrupted the cafe gathering, alleging "love jihad." Police later dismissed the love jihad claim, stating no wrongdoing by the students, yet booked the Muslim attendees and a staffer for disturbing public order.

title: Pakistan kabaddi player wears Indian jersey, waves tricolour; banned indefinitely
content: Pakistan international kabaddi player Ubaidullah Rajput has been indefinitely banned by the Pakistan Kabaddi Federation for playing for an Indian team in a private tournament in Bahrain without a no-objection certificate. Rajput claimed it was a misunderstanding, but the federation cited his participation and representation of an Indian team as violations.

title: Decoded: Barron Trump's friendship with Andrew Tate
content: The focus on Barron Trump followed reporting that he had been in contact with Justin Waller, a Texas-based influencer who presents himself as a close confidant of Andrew and Tristan Tate. Waller has described himself as a “third brother” to the Tates, a phrase meant to signal loyalty rather than family ties. According to his own accounts, he has socialised with Barron and spoken to him regularly, including on personal matters such as dating and navigating public life.

title: Ex-Tesla's AI director Andrej Karpathy warns programmers of falling behind
content: Tesla's ex-AI chief, Andrej Karpathy, warns software engineers face a seismic shift as AI reshapes coding. He admits feeling behind, highlighting a new 'programmable layer' of AI tools. While some studies show mixed productivity gains, industry leaders like Google and Anthropic remain optimistic about AI's role in development.

title: 'We can learn': Tharoor’s 'discipline' retort to Digvijaya Singh’s RSS praise
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor offered a measured response to Digvijaya Singh's praise for the RSS's organizational strength, emphasizing the need for internal discipline. While acknowledging Singh as a friend, Tharoor stated the party can learn from its own 140-year history. Other Congress leaders sharply criticized the RSS, highlighting ideological differences.

title: Indian students placing their bets on destinations beyond the Big 4: Here’s why
content: Indian students are still looking abroad, but they are choosing differently. The US, UK, Canada and Australia now come with higher costs, stricter visa checks and too many unknowns. So many are turning to places that feel more workable—Germany for affordability, New Zealand for stability, and the UAE for proximity and job links. It is study abroad, with fewer surprises.

title: Vijay Hazare Trophy: Virat Kohli's next match for Delhi - All you need to know
content: Virat Kohli made a sensational return to domestic cricket in the Vijay Hazare Trophy 2025–26, scoring 208 runs in his first two matches for Delhi. He became the fastest to 16,000 List A runs with a century against Andhra and followed it with a half-century and two catches against Gujarat.

title: 'Thought I was next Steve Jobs': Google founder shares lesson from early days
content: Google co-founder Sergey Brin shared a key lesson learned from the Google Glass failure, advising entrepreneurs to fully develop their ideas before public stunts. He admitted to rushing commercialization and aiming for a "Steve Jobs moment" prematurely.

title: Is NEET PG student data out for sale? Here is what we know so far
content: Recent media reports suggest NEET PG 2025 candidates’ personal data—including names, contact details, scores, and ranks—may be circulating online and sold to private agents. NBEMS denies any breach at its end and has submitted a report to the Health Ministry. Aspirants face unsolicited calls, stress, and privacy concerns, highlighting the urgent need for transparency and stronger safeguards in the counselling process.

title: President Murmu takes submarine sortie at Karwar naval base - see pics
content: President Droupadi Murmu experienced a submarine sortie aboard the INS Vaghsheer, an indigenous Kalvari class submarine, at the Karwar naval base. Accompanied by Chief of Naval Staff Admiral Dinesh K. Tripathi, this marks the second presidential submarine journey, following APJ Abdul Kalam.

title: UP club brawl: Woman attacked with 'beer' bottle during Christmas celebration
content: A Christmas night celebration turned violent in Bareilly when a woman was allegedly struck on the head with a glass bottle during an argument over a table at a club. The incident, captured on video, saw the woman assaulted by a group of men. Police have registered an FIR and are reviewing CCTV footage to apprehend the accused.

title: Your wallet isn’t as clean as you think: What a microbiologist found living on money
content: Microbiologist Dr. Shweta revealed the hidden fungal colonies thriving on money by culturing it in a lab.  Her findings highlight how everyday cash, passed through many hands, becomes a breeding ground for microbes.  This underscores the importance of diligent hand hygiene to prevent the spread of potential infections.

title: Ratan Tata's 88 birth anniversary: Politicians, industrialists pay tributes
content: India remembered Ratan Tata on his 88th birth anniversary with tributes from political leaders and industrialists. Tata Trusts highlighted his strategic philanthropic approach, while leaders praised his integrity, compassion, and role in reshaping Indian enterprise. His legacy of innovation, trust, and nation-building continues to inspire.

title: Hands tied, face covered: Why did a gangster's Pune civic polls nomination bid fail?
content: Arrested gangster Bandu Andekar and two relatives attempted to file nomination papers for the PMC polls but were unsuccessful due to missing documents. Despite court permission and police escort, they couldn't complete the process, causing disruptions for other candidates.

title: Paragliding pilot dies during takeoff at Bir Billing; tourist survives
content: A tandem paragliding pilot died in a crash shortly after takeoff at Bir Billing, marking the third fatality this year. The incident has raised concerns about safety standards and pilot working conditions. An inquiry is underway, with authorities emphasizing strict adherence to SOPs and passenger screening.

title: How India's economy defied odds in 2025 — but external shocks left a mark
content: India's economy demonstrated remarkable resilience in 2025, achieving 8.2% GDP growth amidst global trade wars and tariffs. A rare 'Goldilocks' phase of low inflation and accommodative monetary policy, coupled with GST 2.0 and tax relief, bolstered domestic demand. The year concluded with mixed stock market trends,  record FIIs, rupee pressure and tariffs highlighting ongoing global uncertainties.

title: 'Nothing will happen to me': BJP corporator's husband accused of assault; arrested after viral video
content: The husband of a BJP corporator in Satna district has been booked for threatening and misbehaving with a woman. A viral video purportedly shows him threatening the woman, who claims he also made objectionable demands. Police have registered a case and apprehended the accused.

title: Rs 1.07 cr for a catch! Fan takes one-handed blinder, steals the show - Watch
content: Ryan Rickelton's stunning 113 went in vain as MI Cape Town fell short by 15 runs in a high-scoring SA20 opener. Durban's Super Giants posted a record 232/5, powered by Devon Conway's 64, before Ethan Bosch's crucial wickets sealed the win.

title: Will Earth really switch to 25 hours days as its rotation slowing down
content: Earth's days are slowly getting longer. This change is driven by the Moon's gravity and shifts in Earth's mass due to melting ice and rising seas. Scientists use advanced tools to measure these tiny shifts. A 25-hour day is a distant future event, taking millions of years. The current changes are imperceptible.

title: US snowstorm chaos: Over 9,000 flights hit; emergency orders in New York, New Jersey
content: A powerful winter storm battered the US Northeast and Great Lakes, causing widespread travel chaos with over 9,000 flights cancelled or delayed. Major transport hubs, particularly in the New York metropolitan area, experienced significant disruptions. States of emergency were declared as snow and ice created treacherous road conditions, impacting peak post-Christmas travel.

title: Watch: Magnus Carlsen loses cool after defeat to Artemiev; pushes cameraman
content: Magnus Carlsen expressed frustration after a loss to Vladislav Artemiev at the World Rapid and Blitz Championships. Artemiev secured the victory with a decisive move, extending his lead in the tournament standings. Carlsen's defeat was followed by an irritated reaction to a cameraman.

title: PAN-Aadhaar linking: Step-by-step guide to link your PAN with Aadhaar before Dec 31
content: PAN-Aadhaar linking deadline nears: Link your PAN with Aadhaar by December 31, 2025, or face consequences. Unlinked PANs become inoperative from January 1, 2026, impacting tax refunds and leading to higher TDS.

title: Lower electricity prices? CERC reviews power trading fee to ease cost
content: Power consumers could soon benefit from lower electricity bills as regulators review trading fees. This move coincides with the upcoming implementation of market coupling, a reform designed to unify electricity prices across trading platforms. The aim is to enhance efficiency and transparency, ultimately reducing procurement costs for buyers.

title: Gas line explosion rocks California: Video shows debris clouds filling the sky
content: A massive natural gas pipeline rupture in Castaic, Los Angeles County, triggered shelter-in-place orders and shut down Interstate 5. Residents reported loud booms and shaking homes, with social media showing large plumes of smoke. While the cause is under investigation, a mudslide is a possible factor. The highway has since reopened.

title: Over 1,230 mine leases exist across Aravalis in Rajasthan
content: Rajasthan's Aravali region grapples with over 1,230 disputed mining leases, impacting 17,393 hectares. Despite a central ban on new leases following public outcry, existing operations continue, causing visible environmental damage like denuded hills and disrupted drainage. Rajsamand, Udaipur, and Jaipur districts bear the brunt of this extensive mining footprint.

title: Deaths spark water contamination protest: Two die, over 10 hospitalised; probe under way
content: Two residents died and over 10 were hospitalized in Karlambakkam Colony, Tiruvallur district, with symptoms of vomiting and diarrhea. Angry residents suspect contaminated drinking water and staged a highway blockade. Authorities are investigating the cause, with initial reports suggesting other factors for the deaths.

title: ‘A man of war’: Russia pounds Ukraine; high-stakes Trump–Zelenskyy talks in focus — 10 key points
content: Ukraine faced a severe Russian aerial assault on Kyiv, killing at least two and injuring dozens, just hours before President Zelenskyy's crucial diplomatic meeting with US President Trump. The strikes, described by Zelenskyy as Moscow's response to peace efforts, highlight the ongoing conflict as Ukraine prepares to present a revised peace plan to Trump.

title: Bihar: 8 wagons of goods train derail, disrupt Howrah–Patna–Delhi rail route
content: Rail traffic on the crucial Howrah–Patna–Delhi route faced significant disruption late Saturday night after eight wagons of a goods train derailed in Bihar's Jamui district. Fortunately, no injuries were reported. The incident, occurring between Lahabon and Simultala stations, affected approximately two dozen trains overnight. Restoration efforts are currently underway.

title: 'Opportunity aayega, mehnat kar': Virat Kohli to Jayswal
content: Like Axar Patel, Jayswal hails from Nadiad in Gujarat’s Kheda district and began his cricket journey at the same academy where Team India’s T20I vice-captain took his first steps. Jayswal lost his father when he was just eight months old. As he grew older, cricket became his passion, and he told his mother of his dream to become a professional cricketer. The road was far from easy, but his mother stood firmly by him.

title: 30–35 terrorists on radar: Army steps up counterterror ops in J&K; intense vigil amid 'Chillai Kalan'
content: Amidst the harsh Chillai Kalan winter, the Army has intensified counter-terrorism operations in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar and Doda districts.  Expanding into snowbound areas, forces are pursuing an estimated 30-35 Pakistani terrorists seeking winter hideouts. An integrated, proactive approach involving multiple agencies ensures continuous pressure and swift responses to intelligence.

title: More tickets to the Northeast please! Did OTT boost regional tourism? What report says
content: Popular OTT series are significantly influencing travel choices, driving a surge in bookings to northeastern Indian cities like Imphal and Agartala. This screen-inspired wanderlust is transforming into tangible travel demand, as the region's landscapes and culture gain mainstream attention.  The trend highlights the growing impact of entertainment on travel decisions.

title: Chhattisgarh coal block protest turns violent; several cops injured, vehicles torched
content: Violence erupted in Chhattisgarh's Tamnar region as villagers protesting a coal block project clashed with police. The sit-in turned violent after authorities detained protesters and a coal truck allegedly injured a villager, leading to torched vehicles and injured officers. Additional forces were deployed to control the volatile situation.

title: Jake Paul and Jutta Leerdam combined net worth in 2025
content: Power couple Jake Paul and Jutta Leerdam boast a combined net worth of $205 million in 2025.  Paul's wealth stems from boxing and business ventures, while Leerdam's comes from Olympic speed skating and sponsorships. Both are actively pursuing their respective careers, with Paul recently engaging in high-profile boxing matches and Leerdam preparing for upcoming international events.

title: Old & bold: When 70+ go skydiving & bungee jumping
content: A group of over 70 Indians, defying age and physical limitations, are embracing adventure. From skydiving and scuba diving to trekking in Antarctica, these seniors are living life to the fullest. Couples like the Kotharis, Thakors, and Vakils are proving that age is merely a number, prioritizing experiences and curiosity over potential hardships, with their bucket lists still growing.

title: Delhi air pollution: AQI hits 391, city back in ‘severe’ category
content: Delhi grappled with severe air pollution on Sunday, with smog obscuring landmarks like Akshardham Temple and reducing visibility across the city. Several areas recorded 'very poor' and 'severe' air quality, with AQI levels exceeding 400 in some parts. In contrast, Mumbai experienced moderate air quality with a light fog.

title: Ashes: 36 wickets in 2 days! MCG curator in 'state of shock'
content: A total of 36 wickets fell in just 142 overs, including 20 on the opening day, with the contest wrapped up in the evening session of day two as England sealed a four-wicket win — their first Test victory in Australia since January 2011.

title: Bengaluru: Night-blind burglar strikes actor’s home, walks away with Rs 65-lakh booty
content: JP Nagar police apprehended Mehaboob Khan Patan, a 38-year-old burglar. His night blindness compelled him to commit crimes only during daylight hours. Patan stole valuables worth Rs 65.2 lakh from actor Praveen Kumar M's residence. He confessed to multiple thefts across states. Recovered items include gold, silver, cash, and a two-wheeler. His arrest solved seven theft cases.

title: Thailand–Cambodia clashes: Indian tourists scout safer New Year destinations
content: Indian travelers are diversifying New Year destinations beyond Thailand and Cambodia due to border violence. Vietnam, Indonesia, Sri Lanka, Japan, and West Asia are gaining popularity. While Thailand sees a slight dip in bookings, Cambodia faces a stronger reaction. Rising airfares also influence choices, favoring shorter, visa-on-arrival destinations.

title: NABARD pegs credit potential for Cuddalore district at ₹27,434.05 crore
content: “PLP for district, which evolved out of consultations with officials at Block, District, and State-level departments in government, banks, and NGOs, also reflected national priorities of Government of India to scale up lending to various sectors of the economy,” says Cuddalore Collector

title: ECI flags technical issue in 2002 rolls, halts hearings for ‘unmapped’ electors in Bengal
content: The Chief Electoral Officer of State issued a directive stating that incomplete conversion of the 2002 electoral rolls from PDF to CSV format has caused linkage failures in the booth-level officer app for some electors

title: Mann Ki Baat: World looking at India with great hope due to ‘youth power’, says PM Modi
content: The Prime Minister said answer to this curiosity of the youth is the 'Viksit Bharat Young Leaders Dialogue', whose first edition was held last year.

title: Three Tamil Nadu fishermen arrested by Sri Lankan Navy
content: Police said the seized trawler was among the 335 mechanised boats which left Mandapam fishing jetty on Saturday

title: President Murmu undertakes submarine sortie at Karwar naval base
content: Droupadi Murmu became the second President to undertake a submarine sortie. In February, 2006, APJ Abdul Kalam became the first president to experience a submarine sortie

title: Congress’s organisational decay fertilises the BJP in Kerala: Pinarayi Vijayan
content: Eight Congress ward members enable the BJP’s ascendancy to power in the Mattanoor Grama Panchayat in Thrissur. Mr Vijayan says “Mattanur model” is portentous for secular and progressive Kerala

title: Over 13 lakh people benefited from 'Nalam Kakkum Stalin' health camps: T.N. CM Stalin
content: “Through full-body health check-ups and consultations with specialist doctors, health issues affecting several lakh people have been identified at an early stage and referred for appropriate advanced treatment,” says Tamil Nadu Chief Minister

title: Punjab, Haryana reel under intense cold; Hisar coldest 2.5 degrees Celsius
content: An intense cold wave continues to batter Punjab and Haryana, with low visibility due to dense fog likely to continue for next few days, says IMD

title: Decode Karnataka: Reflecting on what went down in 2025 and a wishlist for 2026
content: In this year ender episode of Decode Karnataka, an annual tradition of sorts, we take stock of the events and developments that made news in 2025.

title: Rowdy-sheeter externed from district
content: SP, District Collector Dr. A. Siri issued orders externing Tulasi Kumar from the district. Tulasi Kumar’s father, Vadde Ramanjaneyulu, and another rowdy-sheeter, Pathan Imran Khan, were also externed from the district a few days ago

title: Editors Council accuses section in Bangladesh's interim government of allowing violence
content: “We clearly know an announcement came to demolish the Prothom Alo, Daily Star, and the Chhyanat one or two days before the attacks. The people of the country know, and the government, as well, knows who gave the announcement,” says Editors Council President Nurul Kabir

title: How the Aravalli Hills formed and why they look the way they do
content: The Hills’ features are better understood as part of a belt of ancient rocks that many scholars have called the Aravalli-Delhi orogenic belt

title: Mann Ki Baat | PM Modi says 2025 year of proud milestones for India
content: The Prime Minister also noted that 2025 has truly been a memorable year for sports with the men's cricket team clinching the ICC Champions Trophy and the women's cricket team winning the World Cup for the first time

title: Digvijay's remark on X open dissent against Congress, Rahul dooming party: BJP
content: It's because our Narendra Modi is 'guddri ke lal' (diamond in the rough) and their leader is 'Jawahar ke lal' (great-grandson of Jawaharlal Nehru). Since our Narendra Modi has risen to top from bottom, he is taking the party (BJP) also to the top from bottom, says BJP national spokesperson Sudhanshu Trivedi

title: Congress celebrates 141st foundation day asserting it's role in Independence and nation building
content: Telangana Congress chief Mahesh Kumar Goud said the Congress was born out of the determination and sacrifices of great leaders and its contribution to India’s freedom struggle and post-Independence nation-building was unparalleled

title: Congress leaders pull up Pinarayi on Bengaluru demolition remark, but get rapped by AICC
content: AICC general secretary K.C. Venugopal chastised the Karnataka leaders on the clearance drive at Kogilu Layout.

title: PM Office directs Coal India to list all subsidiaries by 2030
content: The move aims to streamline governance, enhance transparency and unlock value through asset monetisation in the coal PSU

title: Kogilu Layout eviction: Congress leaders react strongly to Pinarayi’s remarks
content: Authorities had demolished houses after serving notices on residents who had illegally built them, but the officials had been directed to provide housing to them on humanitarian grounds, Chief Minister Siddaramaiah said.

title: 8 wagons of goods train derail in Bihar, rail traffic disrupted
content: The accident took place between Lahabon and Simultala railway stations under the Asansol division of Eastern Railways around 11.25 p.m. on Saturday (December 27)

title: Ukkadam-Athupalam flyover in Coimbatore to be named after former Union Minister C. Subramaniam: Stalin
content: Mr. Stalin said the announcement was being made following a request from educationist B.K. Krishnaraj Vanavarayar to propagate the legacy of Subramaniam’s illustrious contributions

title: Two arrested, arms and ammunition seized in Manipur
content: “One person, identified as Rebanta Kshetrimayum (49), was arrested from his house in the Pangei Lairam Mapan are,” says a police statement

title: Unnao rape case: SC to hear CBI's plea against HC order suspending Sengar's life sentence on December 29
content: According to the apex court's cause list for December 29, a Bench comprising Chief Justice Surya Kant and Justices J.K. Maheshwari and Augustine George Masih is slated to hear the plea

title: Nine UP men stranded in Kyrgyzstan after job fraud return to Pilibhit
content: Pilibhit District Magistrate Gyanendra Singh told PTI that the process for the return of the remaining three workers was almost complete, and they would be brought back before the year end

title: Pilot killed in paragliding accident in Himachal’s Bir Billing
content: According to officials of the Bir Billing Paragliding Association, the paraglider developed a technical malfunction shortly after take off, lost balance mid-air, and crashed near the road below the launch site.

title: Police, anti-mining protesters clash in Chhattisgarh’s Raigarh; many injured
content: The villagers have been staging a sit-in protest for the past fortnight in Daurabhatha village, opposing the coal block allotted to Jindal Steel in the Tamnar area

title: Had insightful discussions on governance, reforms at Chief Secretaries’ meeting: PM Modi
content: “Had insightful discussions on various issues relating to governance and reforms during the National Conference of Chief Secretaries being held in Delhi,” Mr. Modi said

title: Gangster dies of gunshot wounds in Uttarakhand; family alleges police connivance to grab property
content: Police said Tyagi was being taken from Roorkee jail to Laksar court for a hearing on Wednesday, when two bikers allegedly opened fire at the police vehicle near the Laksar flyover, and shot Tyagi.

title: Chennai scores well in terms of housing sales
content: The data also pointed out that Chennai added approximately 27,190 units in 2025, an annual increase of 30% against the previous year

title: Degrees of disillusionment in Tamil Nadu’s government colleges, universities
content: Judging by headlines alone, faculty members across government colleges and universities in Tamil Nadu have spent the better half of the past two years in upheaval over a plethora of issues that are yet to be resolved. A fair pay scale, timely promotions and clearance of pending increments, regularisation of the services of part-time and temporary employees, restoration of special pay provisions and revival of the old pension scheme are among their demands. Nahla Nainar explains the key issues plaguing higher education in the State

title: The new world of surrendered left-wing extremists
content: The lives of those involved in the Maoist movement remain largely hidden, shaped by a culture of secrecy. Satyasundar Barik speaks with several surrendered red-corridor workers, who describe how their lives have changed since giving up arms and what life inside the Maoist ranks truly looks like

title: Is the ‘health for all’ campaign on track?: Explained
content: What are India’s challenges on the health front? What does it need to do on funding? Why is there a growing resistance to antibiotics? Why did India fail to reach its goals on ending tuberculosis? What does the pharmaceutical industry need to do on quality control?

title: FSSAI tightens testing norms for packaged water, drops BIS mandate
content: Regulator devises scheme for testing packaged drinking water and mineral water; directs manufacturers to comply with it from January 1; consumer groups urge authorities to ensure periodic inspections at plants and shut unauthorised units

title: What are India’s diplomatic headwinds in 2026?: Explained
content: Why has foreign policy in 2025 been full of ‘shock and surprise’? Where does India stand in its ties with the U.S.? Will issues over tariffs, visas, immigration persist in the new year? How troubling is the neighbourhood turmoil, particularly in Pakistan and Bangladesh?

title: V.V. Rajesh: Saffron entry
content: The BJP, which won its first Corporation election in Kerala, has chosen a familiar local face to be the Mayor of Thiruvananthapuram

title: Parties, public cry foul as SIR drive excludes lakhs of voters in Kerala
content: As debate rages over the reported exclusion of around 24 lakh voters from the draft voters’ list of Kerala, after the Special Intensive Revision (SIR) of the electoral rolls, Tiki Rajwi takes a closer look at the process to understand the concerns raised by both voters and political parties.

title: M.P. Congress media head quits amid discontent rumours; party declines resignation
content: As per party insiders, Mr. Nayak, a former State Cabinet Minister, is believed to be upset after a 13-member talent hunt committee appointed by him was cancelled by MPCC general secretary (media and communication)

title: Supreme Court Special Bench to hear suo motu case on ‘definition’ of Aravalli
content: A three-judge Special Vacation Bench headed by Chief Justice of India Surya Kant will hear the matter.

title: Bihar BJP President Saraogi meets Shah and Nadda in Delhi
content: It was Mr. Saraogi’s first meeting with Mr. Shah and Mr. Nadda after being appointed as state president earlier this month. He also met Bihar in-charge Vinod Tawde.

title: 8 Wagons Of Goods Train Derail In Bihar, Disrupts Interstate Rail Traffic
content: Eight wagons of a goods train have derailed in Bihar's Jamui district, causing disruption of railway services on the Howrah-Patna-Delhi route, officials said. No casualties have been reported so far, they said.

title: A "Godse" Remark As Congress Divided Over Digvijaya Singh's "RSS-BJP" Post
content: The Congress appeared divided over senior leader Digvijaya Singh's remarks that appeared to be in favour of the RSS and the BJP, even as he clarified he remained a staunch opponent of their ideologies.

title: Watch: J&K Traffic Cop Suspended For Using Police Vehicle To Shoot Reels
content: A traffic police sub-inspector has been placed under suspension pending an inquiry for allegedly misusing his official vehicle to shoot a reel on the snow-laden Mughal Road in Jammu and Kashmir's Poonch district, officials said.

title: President Droupadi Murmu Undertakes Submarine Sortie At Karnataka Naval Base
content: President Droupadi Murmu on Sunday embarked on a submarine sortie at the Karwar naval base in Karnataka, officials said.

title: Brazil's Jailed Ex-President Jair Bolsonaro Undergoes Surgery For Hiccups
content: 70-year-old Jair Bolsonaro, who is serving a 27-year prison sentence for an attempted coup, was earlier released from prison to undergo surgery for a groin hernia.

title: Congress Leader's "India Too" Remark Over Minorities' Fears In Bangladesh
content: Congress leader Rashid Alvi has condemned the violence against Hindu minorities in Bangladesh and said that the Bangladesh government is responsible for it.

title: PM Modi Praises Youth-Driving Development In 2025's Last 'Mann Ki Baat' Address
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Sunday said the world is looking at India with great expectations, largely because of the country's youth who are driving development in science, technology and digital innovation.

title: UP Drug Syndicate Kingpin Builds Secret Basement At Home, Uses It To Flee During Raid
content: Taslim, who has more than 70 cases registered against him, built the basement to store the drug consignments.

title: Shashi Tharoor Was Asked About Digvijaya Singh Amid Row. What He Said
content: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor has backed senior colleague Digvijaya Singh's call for reforms within the party, asserting the need to strengthen the organisation, in the backdrop of a spiralling controversy over the latter's remark.

title: "Oppose Their Ideology": Digvijaya Singh Clarifies Amid "RSS-BJP" Post Row
content: Congress MP Digvijaya Singh reiterated that he opposes the RSS and BJP's ideology, a day after an image he shared lauding Prime Minister Narendra Modi's rise through organisational ranks sparked rumours of a crisis within the Congress.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Congress Meltdown: In Digvijay Singh's 'RSS' Post, A Reckoning For Rahul
content: From the row between Siddaramaiah and DK Shivakumar in Karnataka, to the sidelining of leaders like Shashi Tharoor and Manish Tewari, to replacing the leadership in Rajasthan, Gandhi can no longer continue evading responsibility.

title: US Calls Bangladeshi Hindu Man's Lynching "Horrific", Congressman Slams "Acts Of Bigotry"
content: The US State Department condemned the "horrific" lynching of a Hindu man in Bangladesh, while Congressman Ro Khanna urged unequivocal condemnation of religious hatred.

title: Watch: Group Of Monkeys In Odisha Risk Lives To Save Companion From Crocodile
content: A group of monkeys in Odisha made a valiant attempt to rescue a companion from a saltwater crocodile. The incident, captured on camera, occurred in the Mahakalapada area of Kendrapara district.

title: Why Delhi's Hot Air Balloons Are Getting A Cold Response From Visitors
content: Low turnout for Delhi hot air balloon rides has forced organisers to slash prices from the initial Rs 3,000 per person to Rs 2,300.

title: Opinion: Opinion | On Christmas And 'Tulsi Diwas' - And, Manufactured Traditions
content: By pinning Tulsi worship to Christmas Day, the architects of this movement aren't trying to honour the plant or our culture; they are trying to colonise the calendar.

title: UP Government Launches AI-Based App "YAKSH" To Strengthen Policing In State
content: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath inaugurated a two-day conference of senior police officers here on Saturday and launched an AI-based "YAKSH" app to strengthen policing and preventive law enforcement in the state.

title: Video Shows Cars Swerving, Men Standing Through Sunroof In Delhi, Cops Respond
content: The video showed several men in four cars performing dangerous stunts, including standing out of sunroofs and screaming as the vehicles sped past.

title: French Man Falls While Climbing Hill In Karnataka, Rescued After 2 Days
content: A French national, who was visiting Karnataka as a tourist, slipped and fell while attempting to climb a hill in Hampi. The incident was reported from the rear side of the Ashtabhuja Snana hill at the world-famous heritage site.

title: Paraglider Crashes After Take-Off In Himachal, Pilot Killed, Tourist Injured
content: An experienced pilot was killed when a tandem paraglider reportedly developed a technical malfunction shortly after take-off, lost balance mid-air, and crashed near the road below the launch site in Kangra district, officials said on Saturday.

title: Dense Smog In Delhi As Air Quality Nears 'Severe' Category
content: The air quality in the national capital remains hazardous, affecting people's health. The overall Air Quality Index (AQI) in Delhi on Sunday reached 391, entering the severe category, with some regions exceeding 400, according to the CPCB.

title: Aravali row: SC takes suo motu cognisance; CJI-led bench to hear case on Monday
content: The Supreme Court has taken suo motu cognizance of its November 20 order on the Aravali hills, registering a new case to address concerns raised by environmentalists. The previous ruling defined Aravali hills for mining purposes as landforms with 100m elevation, a definition critics argue will lead to extensive mining and damage the range's integrity.

title: Tharoor criticises Thiruvananthapuram’s omission from Railway’s ’Vision 2030’, writes to Centre
content: The MP highlights the city’s strategic and operational prominence within the Southern Railway network in letter to Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw

title: Presidents, vice-presidents elected to panchayats across Kerala
content: The Congress-led United Democratic Front and the CPI(M)-led Left Democratic Front win control of seven district panchayats each. In some of the hung panchayats, parties such as the Social Democratic Party of India, Welfare Party and Twenty20 extend support to candidates of major alliances in the election of presidents and vice-presidents

title: T.N.’s growth under DMK government has drawn nation’s attention: Stalin
content: Even Union Ministers are spreading hatred against the State as they could not tolerate its growth; they believe they can secure votes in northern States by targeting Tamil Nadu, says Chief Minister

title: Congress shedding crocodile tears on rural jobs scheme: Chouhan
content: It used Mahatma Gandhi’s name for electoral gains, reduced the budget for MGNREGA and froze wages, alleges Agriculture Minister

title: The Hindu Impact: Minister seeks report on Wildlife First objections to KIOCL forest clearance plea
content: The directive follows a report published by The Hindu on December 24, 2025, which highlighted Wildlife First’s appeal to the Karnataka government to reject KIOCL’s application for retrospective forest clearance.

title: Looking back 2025: The Hindu’s most viewed cartoons
content: A collection of cartoons from The Hindu addressing key political events and controversies in India and abroad from 2025

title: Harassment of Kashmiris in other states is matter of national security: Sajad Lone
content: Mr. Lone urged Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha and Chief Minister Omar Abdullah to intervene in the matter

title: Bangladesh participation uncertain in Kolkata International Book Fair amid clearance issue
content: Publishers and Booksellers Guild say they cannot offer or allot stalls to publishers from Bangladesh until MEA clearance

title: Buon Natale rally turns Thrissur into a living canvas of Christmas joy
content: Over 15,000 Santas participate in the festive procession, blending faith, culture, technology and charity

title: Universal depression screening at primary care level could yield major health, economic gains: Lancet study
content: The study examines the feasibility and cost-effectiveness of integrating population-based depression screening into India’s comprehensive primary healthcare system

title: Unnao rape case: survivor approaches CBI seeking FIR against Investigative Officer for 'colluding' with Sengar
content: In her complaint, the victim alleged that the investigating officer conducted the probe dishonestly, and in such a way that Senger and other accused may get benefits of “deliberate lapses, manipulation of facts introduced, and secure a favourable outcome”

title: Will develop local body as space of happiness: Ernakulam district panchayat president
content: Mr. Radhakrishnan, 47, said the newly elected United Democratic Front (UDF) council’s priority would be to develop the district panchayat in line with the aspirations of the population spread over the metropolitan as well as agrarian areas of the district.

title: Anti-social behaviour will not be tolerated, says A.P. Home Minister
content: Anitha criticises YSRCP activists for sacrificing animals during the birthday celebrations of Jagan Mohan Reddy

title: Vizag steel plant rightful asset of Andhra Pradesh people, says TPCC leader
content: Jagga Reddy says Congress built and safeguarded the public sector unit and alleges attempts by the Centre to privatise it

title: CM asks Ministers, MLAs to be armed with ‘facts and documents’ to counter BRS on Krishna water projects
content: The Chief Minister has directed Ministers and MLAs from the affected districts to prepare district-wise and project-wise rebuttals

title: Installation of rooftop solar power plants being expedited in Rajasthan
content: The exercise, carried out under the revamped distribution sector scheme, along with installation of meters on transformers, is aimed at reducing transmission and distribution losses and improve power supply quality.

title: Sanchara Yukta project may add 90 km of roads beyond GBA limits; plans to widen Wind Tunnel Road
content: Under the Sanchara Yukta project, the government plans to build roads along the buffer zones of storm-water drains and lakes in the city to address growing congestion by expanding the road network

title: CM, DyCM to meet high command after January 6
content: Chief Minister says Congress will launch a protest in the State from January 5 as a part of the nationwide stir, opposing the newly enacted VB-G Ram G

title: Mary Thomas, T.K. Sudheesh take oath as Thrissur district panchayat president, vice-president
content: LDF candidates secure decisive victories in district body elections; formal oath-taking ceremony graced by Ministers, officials, and political leaders

title: Sheela Stephen elected Idukki district panchayat president
content: UDF’s T.S. Siddique is the vice-president. Kerala Congress’s Sheela will hold the post for a year, while Congress nominee Mini Sabu will be in charge for the remaining four years of the term

title: Special camps for draft electoral roll revisions begin in three districts
content: Applications received will be verified by relevant officers and action will be taken to include names in the final voter list to be released in February

title: Kakatiya University Pharma faculty lauded for bringing global recognition to department
content: An alumnus of KU Pharmacy Department, former director of the U.S. FDA Mansoor Khan, recalled the humble beginnings of the college with limited facilities and credited disciplined teachers and peer support for shaping successful careers

title: Congress to form monitoring cells to assist governing committees in local bodies where it is in power
content: The monitoring cells will include senior party leaders, those with administrative experience, and retired officials from local institutions, says DCC chief

title: Henry up to 10th all time in rushing, Ravens win
content: Baltimore running back Derrick Henry moved into 10th place all time in NFL rushing yards Saturday night, finishing with 216, to go along with four touchdowns on the ground, as the Ravens produced a 41-24 win over the Green Bay Packers at Lambeau Field.

title: Bears clinch North title with GB loss; 1st since '18
content: The Chicago Bears locked up the NFC North on Saturday night at the conclusion of Green Bay's 41-24 loss to Baltimore.

title: Packers unsure on Week 18 QB after Willis shines
content: Packers coach Matt LaFleur was noncommittal about the team's starting quarterback for next weekend's regular-season finale after backup quarterback Malik Willis went 18-of-21 for 288 yards and a touchdown in Saturday's loss to the Ravens.

title: Slumping Lakers hold meeting, eye 'recalibration'
content: Lakers coach JJ Redick said Saturday was a day of "recalibration and reconnection" for slumping Los Angeles, which has lost three straight and six of 10.

title: Pels' Alvarado, Suns' Williams tossed after fight
content: Suns center Mark Williams and Pelicans point guard Jose Alvarado were ejected after getting into a fight in the third quarter Saturday night.

title: Team USA's Hutson struck by puck, out of hospital
content: Cole Hutson was briefly hospitalized after a puck appeared to strike him near the back of his helmet during Saturday's World Juniors game against Switzerland.

title: UVA sheds ACC title game loss, secures 11th win
content: Virginia quarterback Chandler Morris threw for 198 yards and the No. 20 Cavaliers, who lost in the ACC title game to Duke with a shot at the College Football Playoff on the line, outlasted 25th-ranked Missouri 13-7 in the Gator Bowl on Saturday night.

title: Giannis returns, draws Bulls' ire with late dunk
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo scored 29 points in his return from an eight-game absence Saturday night, punctuating the Milwaukee Bucks' 112-103 victory over the Chicago Bulls at United Center with a windmill dunk at the buzzer that drew the ire of the home team.

title: What you need to know for every NFL game in Week 17 -- including fantasy tips, playoff implications, predictions
content: Seahawks vs. Panthers. Jalen Hurts vs. Josh Allen. Picks, predictions and more for every remaining Week 17 game.

title: 'It's a crazy story': Why Raiders' Alex Bachman lives in a guesthouse and has no attachments
content: Alex Bachman once found his locker empty before game day. Now he lives by rentals and no attachments.

title: For a team on top of Premier League table, Arsenal haven't looked convincing enough
content: Arsenal relied on an own goal for their fourth straight match, and it's not as convincing as it should be from the team topping the Premier League.

title: Most fashionable arrivals of NFL Week 17, featuring Roquan Smith
content: Before the NFL's Week 17 slate kicked off, players made sure to put their most fashionable foot forward.

title: Burrow gifts O-linemen authentic dinosaur, bear and mammoth fossils for Christmas
content: Burrow's love of fossils gained national acclaim because of a clip from the Netflix series "Quarterback."

content: Friday's "SmackDown" saw a new champion being crowned and the Cody Rhodes-Drew McIntyre rivalry reaching a new level.

content: The U.S. Soccer Federation is expecting to earn $100 million from co-hosting next summer's World Cup, so how will that money be invested in the game?
